definitions.definition: have in or be able to bring to one's mind an awareness of (someone or something that one has seen, known, or experienced in the past).
examples: I remember the screech of the horn as the car came toward me
synonyms: look back on; archaicbethink oneself of "she remembered all those happy times she had spent with them"bear/keep in mind
be mindful of the fact; take into account
take into consideration "you must remember that she's only five"

definitions.definition: do something that one has undertaken to do or that is necessary or advisable.
examples: did you remember to mail the letters?
synonyms: make sure that you "remember to feed the cat"

definitions.definition: used to emphasize the importance of what is asserted.
examples: you must remember that this is a secret

definitions.definition: bear (someone) in mind by making them a gift or making provision for them.
examples: he has remembered the boy in a codicil to his will
synonyms: bestow something on "she remembered them in her will"

definitions.definition: convey greetings from one person to (another).
pray for the success or well-being of.
examples: the congress should be remembered in our prayers
synonyms: pay homage to "the nation remembered those who gave their lives"

definitions.definition: recover one's manners after a lapse.
